string-array.name: instrDescription
string-array.item: Adds the values of two registers and stores the result in another. May cause overflow exception
Adds a constant value to a register and stores the result in another register. May cause overflow exception
Adds a constant value to a register and stores the result in another register. But operands are treated as unsigned i.e. no overflow exception
Adds the values of two registers and stores the result in another. But operands are treated as unsigned i.e. no overflow exception
Performs a bitwise AND operation between two registers, storing the result in another register.
Performs a bitwise AND operation between a register and a constant value, storing the result in another register.
Branches to a target label if two registers are equal.
Branches to a target label if two registers are not equal.
Unconditionally jumps to a target label.
Unconditionally jumps and links to a target label. Will update $ra to $pc + 8
Unconditionally jumps to the address specified by the register. Can be used in conjunction with $ra
Loads an unsigned byte from memory into a register.
Loads an unsigned halfword from memory into a register.
Loads a 16-bit immediate value into the upper 16 bits of a register.
Loads a word from memory into a register.
Performs a bitwise NOR operation between two registers, storing the result in another register.
Performs a bitwise OR operation between two registers, storing the result in another register.
Performs a bitwise OR operation between a register and a constant value, storing the result in another register.
Sets a register to 1 if another register is less than the other register; otherwise, sets it to 0.
Sets a register to 1 if another register is less than a constant value; otherwise, sets it to 0.
Sets a register to 1 if another register is less than a constant value; otherwise, sets it to 0. But operands are treated as unsigned.
Sets a register to 1 if another register is less than the other register; otherwise, sets it to 0. But operands are treated as unsigned.
Performs a bitwise left shift of the value of a register a constant amount of time and stores it in another register. Equivalent to multiplying by 2 a constant amount of time.
Performs a bitwise right shift of the value of a register a constant amount of time and stores it in another register. Zero-extended.
Stores the least significant byte of a register into memory.
Stores the least significant halfword of a register into memory.
Stores a word from a register into memory.
Subtracts the values of two registers and stores the result in another. May cause overflow exception
Subtracts the values of two registers and stores the result in another. But operands are treated as unsigned i.e. no overflow exception
